comment.author: 22948027@N02
comment._content: Text in Norwegian, first picture: Compañia Argentina da Pesca's station i Grytviken, S. Georgia. This company, the first in South Georgia, was founded by the Norwegian captain C.A. Larsen, see this Wikipedia article en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Anton_Larsen Second picture: Fra Godthul. S. Georgia - from Godthul. Godthul harbour, seven miles south of Grytviken, was yet another center for whaling in South Georgia, although no shore station was ever built here. The company with the lease, Bryde & Dahls Hvalfangerselskap from Sandefjord in Norway, chose to work exclusively from floating factory ships, anchored in the fjord. From Tönnesen-Johnsen "The History of Modern Whaling" page 191. The ship on the picture is HB Snorre, according to text on the negative. Text under pictures three and four: Höifjeldspartier fra omegnen av Husvik Hr - Alpine areas around Husvik Harbour.
